item.title: Memory Addressing
item.description: How a CPUâ€™s architecture determines the size of its memory space, how memory addresses work at the byte level, and how these addresses are represented in binary and hexadecimal formats, showing the maximum memory each architecture can handle. A 32-bit CPU architecture means that the process memory space is represented using 32 bits. The lowest memory address in this space can be visualized in binary as 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000.
